div.span: S1
W1
past tense and past participle made

span.span: to produce something, for example by putting the different parts of it together

div.span: I’m going to show you how to make a box for your tools.
我来教你怎么做一个箱子存放工具。
A family of mice had made their nest in the roof.
一窝老鼠在屋顶上安了家。
She made her own wedding dress.
她的婚纱是自己做的。
The company has been making quality furniture for over 200 years.
这家公司制作优质家具有两百多年的历史了。
They met while they were making a film.
他们是在拍电影时认识的。
Make a list of all the things you need.
把你需要的所有物品列一份清单。
He made her a toy horse, using just some straw and bamboo twigs.
他仅用了些稻草和竹枝就给她做了个玩具马。
Paper is made from wood.
纸是用木材制成的。
a shirt made of silk
真丝衬衫
She’s very good at making things from old scraps of material.
她很会用旧的碎料来制作东西。
a wine made from Chilean grapes
用智利出产的葡萄酿造的葡萄酒
The wheels were made of wood.
这些轮子是木头做的。
make somebody something
make somebody something He made her a toy horse, using just some straw and bamboo twigs.
be made from something
be made from something Paper is made from wood.
be made (out) of something
be made (out) of something a shirt made of silk
make something from/out of something
make something from/out of something She’s very good at making things from old scraps of material.
Japanese-made/English-made etc
Japanese-made/English-made etc (=produced in Japan etc)
日本制造/英国制造等

span.span: used with some nouns to say that someone does something
进行；作出〔与某些名词连用，表示某人做某事〕

div.span: Anyone can make a mistake.
任何人都可能犯错。
I can’t make a decision just yet.
我还没法作出决定。
I need to make a quick phone call.
我需要很快地打个电话。
You could have made more effort to talk to him.
你其实可以再想想办法和他谈谈。
He made no attempt to apologize.
他没有去道歉。
Could I make a suggestion?
我能提个建议吗？
There are a few points I’d like to make.
有几点我想说明一下。
The police were called but no arrests were made.
警察被叫来了，但没有逮捕什么人。
I suppose we should make a start on cleaning this room.
我想我们应该开始打扫房间了。
Stop making such a fuss!
别这样大惊小怪的！

span.span: to cook or prepare food or drink

div.span: When was the last time you made a cake?
你上次做蛋糕是什么时候？
John was making breakfast in the kitchen.
约翰在厨房做早餐。
Who’s going to make the tea?
谁去泡茶？
I’ll make you some sandwiches.
我来给你做点三明治。
make somebody something
make somebody something I’ll make you some sandwiches.

span.span: to cause something to happen, or cause a particular state or condition

div.span: Its beautiful beaches make this a highly popular area with tourists.
美丽的海滩使这里成为游客云集的地方。
It was this movie which made him a star.
就是这部电影使他成为明星的。
His attitude made him very unpopular with colleagues.
他的态度使他很不受同事欢迎。
The photo makes her look much older than she really is.
这张照片使她看起来比实际年龄大得多。
I like him because he makes me laugh.
我喜欢他是因为他能逗我笑。
The use of computers has made it possible for more people to work from home.
计算机的应用使更多人能在家办公。
Over 80,000 people attended, making it the biggest sporting event in the area.
八万多人到场使这场运动会成了当地最大的体育盛事。
The president has made it clear that he is not going to change his mind.
总统已经明确表示他不会改变主意。
His attitude caused him to be unpopular with colleagues.
他的态度令他不受同事欢迎。
make somebody/something do something
make somebody/something do something I like him because he makes me laugh.

span.span: to force someone to do something

div.span: My parents always make me do my homework before I go out.
我父母总是要我做完作业才能出去。
I was made to wait four hours before I was examined by a doctor.
我被迫等了四个小时才有一个医生给我做检查。
make somebody do something
make somebody do something My parents always make me do my homework before I go out.
be made to do something
be made to do something I was made to wait four hours before I was examined by a doctor.

span.span: to cause a mark, hole etc to appear

div.span: Make a hole in the paper.
在纸上挖一个洞。
The cup has made a mark on the table.
茶杯在桌上留了个印痕。

span.span: to succeed in getting somewhere in time for something or when this is difficult
〔尤指在困难情况下〕准时到达，赶上

div.span: If we run, we should make it.
如果我们跑的话，应该来得及。
With blood pouring from his leg, he made it to a nearby house.
虽然腿上鲜血直流，他还是坚持走到了附近的一所房子。
He came to the US and not only made it but made it big (=was extremely successful).
他来到美国，不仅成功了，而且是大获成功。
So far, relatively few women have made it to the top in the business world.
到目前为止，在商业圈里做到很高职位的女性还是相对很少。
He was told he had no talent and would never make it as a professional singer.
他被告知他不具备天分，永远无法成为职业歌手。
England look less likely to make it to the finals.
英格兰队看起来进入决赛的可能性较小。
How did anyone so stupid make it to manager?
这么愚蠢的人怎么当上经理的？
I’m really sorry, but I won’t be able to make it on Sunday after all.
非常抱歉，我星期天还是不行。
Nice to see you. I’m glad you could make it.
见到你真好。我很高兴你能来。
Frank was very ill, and the doctors didn’t think he’d make it.
弗兰克病情非常严重，医生认为他挺不过来了。
I couldn’t have made it through those times without the support of my boyfriend.
没有我男朋友的支持我是不可能渡过那些难关的。
What time do you make it?
你的表几点？
I make it ten past three.
我的表是三点十分。
make it to With blood pouring from his leg, he made it to a nearby house.
make it as He was told he had no talent and would never make it as a professional singer.
make it to England look less likely to make it to the finals.
make it through I couldn’t have made it through those times without the support of my boyfriend.

span.span: to be able to go to something that has been arranged for a particular date or time
能够出席[参加]会议/聚会/周二的活动等

div.span: I’m sorry, I can’t make Friday after all.
对不起，我礼拜五还是不行。
Will you be able to make the next meeting?
下一个会议你能参加吗？

span.span: to succeed in achieving a particular position, rate etc
成功获得[达到]〔某一位置、速度等〕

div.span: He was never good enough to make the team.
他一直都不够好，进不了球队。
I don’t think we’ll make the deadline.
我认为我们无法按时完成。
The plan could cost you more than you would make.
这个计划可能会让你入不敷出。
They made a profit of £140 million.
他们获得了1.4亿英镑的利润。
His one aim in life was to make money.
他人生的一个目标就是挣钱。
She hopes to make a living (=earn the money she needs to live) from writing children’s books.
她希望靠写儿童故事书来谋生。
He’s made a fortune (=earned a lot of money) selling computers on the Internet.
他在网上卖计算机赚了大钱。
How easy is it to make money out of gardening?
靠从事园艺挣钱有多容易？
make something out of something
make something out of something How easy is it to make money out of gardening?

span.span: to have the qualities that are necessary for a particular job, use, or purpose

div.span: I’m sure you will make a very good teacher.
我相信你一定会成为一名非常出色的老师。
The hall would make an ideal venue for a wedding reception.
这个大礼堂是举办婚宴的理想场所。
An old cardboard box makes a comfortable bed for a kitten.
一个旧纸板盒可以给小猫咪做一个舒适的窝。
You’ll make a wonderful father.
The leaves make a pretty table decoration.
make noun I’m sure you will make a very good teacher. The hall would make an ideal venue for a wedding reception. An old cardboard box makes a comfortable bed for a kitten.

span.span: used to correct what you have just said
是…，应该是…〔用于纠正刚说过的话〕

div.span: Can we have two cups of coffee, please? No, make that three.
请给我们来两杯咖啡好吗？不对，是三杯。

span.span: to manage with the things that you have, even though this is not really enough

div.span: I hardly had any food in the house so I just had to make do.
家里几乎没有什么吃的东西，所以我只能凑合一下。
I usually make do with a cup of coffee for breakfast.
我通常早饭喝杯咖啡就算了。
For many people, make do and mend (=when someone manages with the things they have and does not buy anything new) was a harsh reality.
对许多人而言，不买新的物品而将就度日是残酷的现实。
make do with/without I usually make do with a cup of coffee for breakfast.

span.span: to succeed in getting someone to hear you, understand you, or know that you are there
让人听到/理解/知道等自己

div.span: I had to shout to make myself heard above the music.
我得大声喊，才能让我的声音盖过音乐让人听到。

span.span: to be a particular amount when added together

div.span: Two and two make four.
二加二等于四。
There are nine people coming, plus me, which makes ten.
要来九个人，加上我总共十个。

span.span: used to say what you have calculated a number to be

div.span: I make that $150 altogether.
我算出总共为150美元。

span.span: to achieve a particular score in a sports game

div.span: Surrey had made 92 by lunchtime.
萨里队到吃午饭的时候已经得了92分。

span.span: to give someone a new job or position in a group, organization etc
任命某人为队长/领导等

div.span: She’s now been made a full partner.
她现在已是正式合伙人。
He was made mayor in 1998.
他1998年被任命为市长。

span.span: to pretend or imagine that something is true when it is not

div.span: I tried to make believe she was happy, but knew deep down it wasn’t true.
我试图把她想成是快乐的，但我内心里知道并非如此。

span.span: to behave as if something is true when it is not

div.span: He makes like he never met me before.
他装作以前从未见过我。

span.span: to seem as if you are going to do something but then not do it

div.span: She made as if to speak but then stopped.
她欲言又止。

span.span: to arrive at or get to a particular place, especially when it is difficult
〔尤指在有困难的情况下〕到达〔某处〕

div.span: I don’t think we’re going to make the town before nightfall.
我认为我们天黑前到不了镇上。

span.span: to be interesting or important enough to be printed in a newspaper, reported on television etc
登上报纸/成为头条新闻/成为头版新闻等

div.span: News of their divorce made the headlines.
他们离婚的消息成了头条新闻。

span.span: to cause something or someone either to be very successful or to fail completely
使大为成功或彻底失败，不成则毁

div.span: Critics can make or break a young performer.
批评家可以成就也可以毁掉一名年轻艺人。

span.span: used to say that you agree with someone or that something that is true of them is true of you too
对我来说也是如此；对我同样适用

div.span: ‘I haven’t a clue what’s going on.’ ‘That makes two of us.’
“我一点也不知道是怎么回事。”“我也一样。”

span.span: to make something complete or successful

div.span: The hat makes the outfit.
这顶帽子给整套服装增色不少。

span.span: to steal something and take it away with you

div.span: Thieves made away with the contents of the safe.
小偷把保险柜里的东西都偷走了。

span.span: to steal something and take it away with you
to go in the direction of a particular place

div.span: I think it’s time we made for home.
我想我们该回家了。
Both teams are on good form, which should make for a great game.
两支球队状态都不错，因此这将是一场精彩的比赛。

span.span: to go in the direction of a particular place
to cause a particular result or situation
to change something so that it has a different form or purpose

div.span: We can make your room into a study.
我们可以把你的房间改成书房。
The movie made her into a star overnight.
那部电影使她一夜之间成了明星。

span.span: to change something so that it has a different form or purpose
to change someone’s character, job, position in society etc
使转变为〔指改变某人的性格、工作或社会地位等〕
to have a particular opinion about or understanding of something or someone

div.span: I didn’t know what to make of her.
我不知道该如何看待她。
What do you make of the idea?
你对这个主意有什么看法？
I want to make something of my life.
我想这辈子有所成就。
She has the ambition and talent to make something of herself.
她志大才高，必会有所作为。
We’ve only got one day in Paris, so we’d better make the most of it.
我们在巴黎只有一天时间，所以我们最好能充分利用它。
It would be a mistake to make too much of these findings.
对这些发现过于重视是错误的。
We decided to take a picnic and make a day of it.
我们决定搞个野餐，玩上一天。
make something of yourself
make something of yourself She has the ambition and talent to make something of herself.

span.span: to have a particular opinion about or understanding of something or someone
to use the opportunities that you have in order to become successful

div.span: make something of yourself
make something of yourself She has the ambition and talent to make something of herself.

span.span: to get as much advantage as you can from a situation while you are able to
to treat something as if it is more important than it really is
to spend a whole day, night etc doing something, because you have chosen to
花整天/整夜/整个晚上的时间做某事
to leave quickly, especially in order to escape
〔尤指为了逃跑〕匆忙离开；溜掉

div.span: The men made off as the police arrived.
警察一到这些人就赶快开溜。
The getaway car made off towards Horrocks Avenue.
逃逸汽车往霍罗克斯大街方向开去。
along/across/through etc The getaway car made off towards Horrocks Avenue.

span.span: to steal something and take it away with you

div.span: Thieves broke into the school and made off with computer equipment worth £40,000.
窃贼闯入学校，盗走了价值四万英镑的计算机设备。

span.span: to be just able to see or hear something

div.span: He could just make out a dark shape moving towards him.
他隐约看到有个黑影朝他走来。
I couldn’t make out what he was saying.
我听不清他在说些什么。
I couldn’t make out what I had done to annoy her.
我不知我做了什么惹她不高兴。
As far as I can make out, he has never been married.
据我所知，他一直没有结婚。
Stuart’s a strange guy – I can’t make him out at all.
斯图尔特是个怪人——我根本不能理解他。
She was making out a list of people to invite.
她正在列一份邀请名单。
The book gives advice on making out a will.
本书指导你如何写遗嘱。
Make the cheque out to ‘Grays Ltd’.
把支票开给格雷斯有限公司。
The situation was never as bad as the media made out.
情况根本没有媒体所声称的那样糟。
She always tried to make out that I was wrong and she was right.
她总要把我说成是错的，把她自己说成是对的。
He makes me out to be some sort of idiot.
他把我说得有点像白痴。
We made out a case for hiring another assistant.
我们找到了要再雇一名助手的理由。
How did you make out this morning?
你今天上午进展如何？
The lawyers made out like bandits.
这些律师赚钱多得像强盗打劫似的。
make out who/what etc
make out who/what etc I couldn’t make out what he was saying.
make out what/how/why etc
make out what/how/why etc I couldn’t make out what I had done to annoy her.
make something ↔ out to Make the cheque out to ‘Grays Ltd’.
make out (that)
make out (that) She always tried to make out that I was wrong and she was right.
make somebody/something out to be something
make somebody/something out to be something He makes me out to be some sort of idiot.

span.span: to be just able to see or hear something

div.span: make out who/what etc
make out who/what etc I couldn’t make out what he was saying.

span.span: to understand something, especially the reason why something has happened
明白，弄懂〔尤指某事发生的原因〕

div.span: make out what/how/why etc
make out what/how/why etc I couldn’t make out what I had done to annoy her.

span.span: to understand someone’s character and the way they behave
懂得，理解〔某人的品性及做事方式〕
to write something such as a bill or cheque

div.span: make something ↔ out to Make the cheque out to ‘Grays Ltd’.

span.span: to say that something is true when it is not

div.span: make out (that)
make out (that) She always tried to make out that I was wrong and she was right.
make somebody/something out to be something
make somebody/something out to be something He makes me out to be some sort of idiot.

span.span: to find good reasons that prove something or show why you need something
找到充分理由证明[解释]（某事）
to succeed or progress in a particular way
〔在某方面〕取得成功；取得进展
to kiss and touch someone in a sexual way
to get or win a lot of money
获得大量金钱；赢得大量钱财
to change a person or thing into something else

div.span: The Olympics can make sporting heroes out of previously little-known athletes.
奥运会能把原本名不见经传的运动员变成体育英雄。

span.span: to officially and legally give money or property to someone else
〔正式合法〕转让〔钱财或不动产〕

div.span: He made over the whole estate to his son.
他把全部财产转让给了自己的儿子。
Redgrave has made herself over completely for her movie role.
雷德格雷夫彻底改变了自己来适应那个电影角色。
to He made over the whole estate to his son.

span.span: to officially and legally give money or property to someone else
〔正式合法〕转让〔钱财或不动产〕

div.span: to He made over the whole estate to his son.

span.span: to change someone or something so that they look different or have a different use

div.span: She made towards the door.
她向门口走去。

span.span: to combine together to form something

div.span: Women make up only a small proportion of the prison population.
女性只占囚犯人数的一小部分。
The committee is made up of representatives from every state.
该委员会由来自各个州的代表组成。
Oxygen makes up roughly 20% of the atmosphere.
Customers under 25 are important, making up a quarter of the total.
I think they’re making the whole thing up.
我认为整件事情是他们编出来的。
Nick made up a song about them.
尼克创作了一首关于他们的歌曲。
When you’re the boss you can make up your own rules.
如果你是老板，你就可以自己制定规则。
I’ve given talks so many times that now I just make them up as I go along (=think of things to say as I am speaking).
我作过太多次演讲，现在都能张口就来了。
I could make up a bed for you on the sofa.
我可以给你在沙发上铺个床。
Can you make up a bottle of milk for the baby?
你能给宝宝准备一瓶奶吗？
They made him up as an old man for the last act of the play.
戏的最后一幕中他们把他扮成一个老人。
One lucky winner will have the chance to be made up and photographed.
一名幸运的获胜者将有机会化妆照相。
I saved as much as I could, and my parents made up the rest.
我尽自己所能攒了一些钱，余款由我父母凑齐。
The company will be forced to pay $6 million to make up the difference.
公司将被迫支付600万美元来补足差额。
I’m trying to make up the time I lost while I was sick.
我正在设法补回我生病耽误的时间。
Is it OK if I make the work up next week?
我下星期再把工作补上可以吗？
Have you made up with Patty yet?
你跟帕蒂和好了吗？
Oh come on! Why don’t you just kiss and make up?
好了！你们干吗不和好呢？
The dress had been made up to her exact requirements.
裙子是严格按照她的要求缝制的。
I plan on making that material up into a dress.
我打算把那块衣料做成一条连衣裙。
be made up of something
be made up of something The committee is made up of representatives from every state.
with Have you made up with Patty yet?
make something ↔ up into I plan on making that material up into a dress.

span.span: to combine together to form something

div.span: be made up of something
be made up of something The committee is made up of representatives from every state.

span.span: to pretend that something is true in order to deceive someone
to produce a new story, song, game etc by thinking
创作，编写〔故事、歌曲、游戏等〕
to prepare something by mixing things or putting things together
to put make-up (=special coloured substances) on someone’s face in order to make them look better or different
to add to an amount in order to bring it up to the level that is needed
to work at times when you do not usually work, because you have not done as much work as you should
to become friendly with someone again after you have had an argument

div.span: with Have you made up with Patty yet?

span.span: to produce something from cloth by cutting and sewing

div.span: make something ↔ up into I plan on making that material up into a dress.

span.span: to make a bad situation better, or replace something that has been lost
弥补，补偿〔不良情况或失去之物〕

div.span: The team will be anxious to make up for a disappointing start to the season.
该球队将急于扭转本赛季初表现令人失望的局面。
I don’t eat breakfast but I make up for it at lunch.
我不吃早饭，但会在吃午饭的时候补回来。
The good days more than make up for the bad ones.
愉快的日子足够抵消不愉快的日子。
What Jay lacked in experience, he made up for in enthusiasm.
杰伊用热情来弥补经验上的不足。
Caroline doesn’t have a natural talent for music but she makes up for it with hard work.
卡罗琳的音乐天分不高，但她的刻苦弥补了不足。
I’m sorry I was late. To make up for it, let me treat you to a meal.
很抱歉我来晚了。让我请你吃饭作为弥补吧。
We rehearsed all day Saturday, to make up for lost time.
我们星期六排练了一整天，以补回失去的时间。
Palin didn’t travel much as a young man but he’s certainly made up for lost time now.
帕林年轻时不怎么旅游，但他现在显然已经补回来了。
in/with What Jay lacked in experience, he made up for in enthusiasm. Caroline doesn’t have a natural talent for music but she makes up for it with hard work.

span.span: to make a bad situation better, or replace something that has been lost
弥补，补偿〔不良情况或失去之物〕
to have so much of one quality that it is not important that you do not have much of another one
〔太多的某一品质〕弥补〔另一品质的不足〕

div.span: in/with What Jay lacked in experience, he made up for in enthusiasm. Caroline doesn’t have a natural talent for music but she makes up for it with hard work.

span.span: to do something to show that you are sorry for doing something that upset or annoyed someone
弥补〔给别人造成的不快〕
to work more quickly, or at times when you do not usually work, because something has prevented you from doing the work before
to do something to show that you are sorry about the problems you have caused someone

div.span: I’ll make it up to you somehow.
我会想办法补偿你的。
He was looking for a way to make up to her for what he had done.
他在想办法向她弥补自己所做的一切。
He was a security guard before he was made up to reception manager.
在升为前台经理之前他是一名保安。

span.span: to do something to show that you are sorry about the problems you have caused someone
to say nice things to someone or be very friendly to them in order to get an advantage for yourself – used to show disapproval
to be given a higher position in an organization
the name of a particular product or of the company that makes it

div.span: What make is your car?
你的车是什么牌子的？
It’s one of the most popular makes of satellite phone on the market.
这是市场上最流行的卫星电话品牌之一。
make of It’s one of the most popular makes of satellite phone on the market.

span.span: to be trying to get money or power – used to show disapproval

div.span: He was just a salesman on the make.
他就是个只想赚钱的推销员。
past tense and past participle made

span.span: to produce something by working or by using industrial processes

div.span: The company makes and sells pumps and motors.
a label on the toy read ‘ made in Taiwan’
The purpose of this business is to make money.
He expects to make $100,000 this year.

span.span: to earn the money you need to live

div.span: He makes a good living selling used cars.

span.span: to make more or less money than you spend

div.span: The company made a pretax profit of £309,000.

span.span: if a financial institution makes a market in particular shares etc, it has them available for people and organizations to buy at all times

div.span: The company said it would no longer make a market in government securities.

span.span: if you make good on a promise or loan, you do what you promised or give back money that is owed

div.span: How does Honda plan to make good its pledge?
Pirelli intends to make good on any trading losses by its allies.
make good onPirelli intends to make good on any trading losses by its allies.

span.span: to be successful in a particular activity or business

div.span: This is a tough business, but I hope you make it.
He failed in his efforts to make it big in Los Angeles.

span.span: to cause either great success or complete failure

div.span: They were well aware that large scale investment would make or break the company.
This is a make-or-break year for us.

span.span: a particular name for a product made by a particular company

div.span: The goods were the manufacturer’s own make.
Its devices can work with many different makes of computer.
make ofIts devices can work with many different makes of computer.

span.span: to be always trying to get an advantage for yourself
